description_text:
Support a startup making solar energy even more sustainable ☀️

The Solar Manager
Solar Manager is building the platform to operate and scale the world’s solar infrastructure.

Solar is breaking global deployment records every year — yet asset performance and reporting remain stuck in the past. $10B+ in value is lost annually due to underperformance, rising interest rates, and outdated tools. At the same time, compliance is becoming more complex, with new regulations like the UK's Biodiversity Net Gain and the US IRA-linked reporting.

We’re building a unified, AI-powered platform to automate reporting, optimize performance, and simplify compliance for solar asset owners — from pension funds to independent operators.

Our goal is simple: accelerate clean energy with smarter infrastructure.

Role (Volunteer): TypeScript Engineer (React or Node.js).

Role Description: We’re looking for a TypeScript Engineer (frontend or backend) to help us build the foundations of our product. You’ll work directly with the founder on features that transform how asset owners manage and report on solar infrastructure.

This is an opportunity to build a climate product from the ground up — and help shape both the codebase and product direction.

🔧 What You’ll Help Us Build
Core functionality for solar reporting workflows
A clean, intuitive user interface (if frontend-focused)
Robust APIs and service logic (if backend-focused)
Simple, scalable architecture that’s easy to extend
Integrations with third-party APIs and datasets (e.g. MeterOnline, regulatory data)

⚙️ Tech We’re Using
TypeScript across the stack
React + Tailwind on the frontend
Node.js, Express, Drizzle ORM, and Supabase on the backend
PostgreSQL, JWT auth, GraphQL (planned)
You don’t need to know all of this — just be excited to learn and build.

🧠 About You
You’ve worked with TypeScript, either in React or Node.js
You enjoy building from 0–1 and solving messy, real-world problems
You’re excited about the climate tech space or want to get involved

Time Commitment: Volunteer 2-3 hours per week for 1-2 months remotely 💻

If you want to make change, apply to volunteer with The Solar Manager!

linkedin_org_description:
Reforged Labs empowers game studios to supercharge their performance marketing. Our AI copilot, the first platform built for mobile game marketing, enables UA managers to achieve results 10x faster and more cost-effectively.

By analyzing thousands of top-performing ads, our platform uncovers what makes an ad effective. Backed by real-world data, it transforms how UA managers brainstorm ideas, create video ads, and launch high-performing campaigns—delivering a competitive edge in the evolving gaming industry. With Reforged Labs, you don’t just keep up with trends—you set them.
description_text:
About Us
Reforged Labs is a YC-backed, Sandhill Road funded AI startup revolutionizing how the world's top mobile gaming studios market themselves to hundreds of millions of players. We're building cutting-edge AI technology that powers sophisticated ad analysis and generation pipelines for elite global gaming companies.

We don't follow trends; we set them. As a founding engineer, you'll be instrumental in establishing our technical culture and building solutions that rival the best Silicon Valley has to offer.

The Role
We're seeking an exceptional Founding Engineer to join our core team in San Francisco and Vietnam. This is not just a senior engineering role—you'll be a part of the founding team helping define our entire technology stack, engineering culture, and product direction.

You'll own major technical initiatives from conception to deployment, directly collaborating with founders on strategic decisions while building the foundational systems that will scale to serve hundreds of millions of users.

Core Responsibilities
Technical Leadership: Drive architectural decisions and establish engineering best practices as we scale from startup to scale-up
Full Ownership: Take complete ownership of core platform components, from agentic AI systems to user-facing applications
Founding Impact: Help shape product direction, technical strategy, and company culture as an early team member
System Architecture: Design and build intelligent agent systems, scalable data pipelines, and high-performance APIs
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work directly with founders, design, and business teams to translate vision into technical reality
Team Building: Help recruit and mentor the next wave of engineers as we grow the team
Customer Impact: Build features that directly generate millions in value for top gaming studios globally

Required Experience
5+ Years of backend development with complex distributed systems
Agentic AI Systems: Hands-on experience building and deploying agentic workflows in production
Expert-level Golang: Demonstrated mastery of concurrency, performance optimization, and production systems
Cloud Platform Expertise: Deep experience with AWS or GCP production environments
Full-Stack Capability: Comfortable working across the entire stack when needed
Startup Experience: Previous experience at early-stage companies (seed to Series A preferred)
Technical Leadership: History of leading technical initiatives and mentoring other engineers

Founding Engineer Qualities
Ownership Mindset: You think like an owner, not just an employee—willing to do whatever it takes to make the company successful
Versatility: Comfortable wearing multiple hats and jumping between different technical challenges
Strategic Thinking: Ability to balance immediate needs with long-term architectural decisions
Customer-First: Understanding that great engineering serves great customer outcomes
Cultural Builder: Help establish the engineering culture and values that will define our team
Risk-Comfortable: Thrives in uncertainty and ambiguity typical of early-stage startups
Mission-Driven: Genuinely excited about our vision and willing to commit years to building something extraordinary

Interview Process
1. Founder Interview (60 mins)
Vision alignment and founding team chemistry
Technical background and leadership experience
Discussion of equity, role expectations, and startup life
2. Technical Deep Dive (90 mins)
Architecture and system design challenge
Live coding session
Discussion of previous technical leadership experiences
3. Take-Home Project (1 week)
Build a foundational component for our platform
Demonstrate full-stack capabilities and technical judgment
4. Final Round (2 hours)
Present and defend your project to the full founding team
Strategic technical planning discussion
Culture fit and long-term vision alignment
We move quickly—expect the entire process to complete within 1-2 weeks.

Why Join as a Founding Engineer
1. Financial Upside
Significant equity package: Founding engineer equity allocation (0.5-2%+ depending on experience)
Competitive salary for SF market rates
2. Impact & Growth
Direct founder access: Work closely with founders on strategy and vision
Technical autonomy: Freedom to make architectural decisions and choose technologies
Career acceleration: Founding engineer experience opens doors throughout Silicon Valley
Global impact: Build technology used by studios reaching hundreds of millions of players
Learning opportunity: Gain deep experience in cutting-edge AI/ML applications
3. Culture & Environment
Y Combinator centric: Heart of the tech ecosystem with access to top talent and investors
Technical excellence: High engineering standards with adequate time to build things right
Rapid iteration: Ship meaningful features and see immediate customer impact
Diverse perspectives: Build an inclusive culture from the ground up
Work-life integration: Sustainable pace that recognizes founding engineer commitment

Our Engineering Philosophy
As a founding engineer, you'll help establish our core engineering principles:
Quality over speed: We move fast, but never at the expense of fundamental quality
Ownership culture: Each engineer owns their domain completely, from architecture to customer success
Continuous learning: Stay at the forefront of AI/ML developments and engineering best practices
Customer obsession: Every technical decision ultimately serves our customers' success
Open communication: Direct, honest feedback and collaborative decision-making

Location & Logistics
Full Remote: This role is fully remote, though San Francisco is preferred

Note: This role is designed for exceptional engineering talent who want to build something transformative from the ground up. If you're not ready for the intensity, uncertainty, and ownership that comes with being a founding engineer at a fast-growing startup, this position isn't the right fit.
If you're an exceptional engineer who wants to help build the next generation of AI-powered gaming technology and are excited about the founding engineer journey, we want to talk to you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

description_text:
Build What Matters, Simply And Efficiently

Agilious leads with a singular purpose - to empower organizations to build digital solutions that truly serve people by simplifying software delivery and eliminating waste. With over 20 years of experience in strategy, design, engineering, and data, our clients count on us not just to deliver technology but to strengthen your teams with the skills, training, and strategy they need to create real, user-focused impact at scale.

About The Role

Agilious is seeking a skilled Senior Platform DevEx/DevOps Engineer to support our work for the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) at the National Library of Medicine (NLM), an institute of the National Institutes of Health. NCBI advances science and public health by providing free access to biomedical literature and genomic data over the web, making it one of the 400 top most-visited sites in the world. NCBI's diverse staff of smart, talented, and deeply technical people collaborate to build critically valuable services for researchers, physicians, educators, students, and the general public. For example, NCBI develops and delivers PubMed, an index of over 29 million biomedical research abstracts, often with links to full-text literature and supporting data.

The Platform Services team builds and maintains the systems that software developers use to ensure that they are consistently pushing and deploying high quality code that complies with Federal Standards for application security and mature code practices.

Tools for creating and setting up new projects consistently across the org.
CI pipelines and build tools for consistent expectations across languages and application frameworks
Testing frameworks and metrics to assure only quality and secure code can be sent to production.
Deployment and publishing pipelines to bring applications to their users in on-premises and cloud environments, and to provide public access to open-source projects.
Integrations for the secure management of deployment parameters, credentials, and more.
Tooling to allow applications to communicate asynchronously, monitor performance metrics, debug live applications and much more.

Location/Remote: This position is full-time and is primarily remote, with select day(s) working from a location in the DC-MD-VA metro region.

What You’ll Do

As a Senior Platform DevEx engineer, you'll be a part of a highly experienced cross-functional team of around 20, building and maintaining tools and systems that allow developers across NCBI to build, deploy, and maintain software and web services that are used around the world.

GitLab CI pipeline configuration, templates, and components to build a standardized ecosystem for developers across the organization to use for their applications, in many languages, from C++ to Scala, Kotlin, and Python.
Python applications, scripts, and libraries to provide interfaces for DevOps and customer tools to manage builds, deployments, and more.
Kubernetes configuration templates using the YTT templating language to create and maintain customizable patterns for consistent deployments across application teams
Debugging deployments on Kubernetes distributions like OpenShift and Anthos and using plugins like ArgoCD, Istio, and more.
Documentation knowledge bases for each component project and the DevEx platform as a whole, in READMEs and on Confluence.
Leading smaller projects within the DevEx teams to add new capabilities to the platform.
Other similar professional duties may be assigned as needed

Qualifications

Clearance: Public Trust Clearance must be obtainable

Required Skills

7+ years of direct experience
Strong coding fluency in at least one programming language. NCBI uses Python, C++, JavaScript/Typescript, some Kotlin & Scala, and small amounts of Golang and Rust.
A working knowledge of Linux systems and the command line
Familiarity with source control, CI/CD pipelines, package publishing, and containerization

Preferred Skills And Experience

Experience developing CLI applications
Experience building and deploying web APIs to cloud services or Kubernetes
Familiarity with container orchestration tools like Kubernetes or Nomad, and Kubernetes distributions like OpenShift Container Platform, Anthos, GKE, AKS, EKS, etc.
Familiarity with observability tools like Prometheus, the EFK (ElasticSearch, fluentd, Kibana) or TIGK (Telegraph InfluxDB, Grafana, Kapacitor) stacks, DataDog, Sensu, Jaeger, Sentry, or OpsGenie.
Familiarity with GitLab CI/CD pipelines

Bonus Skills And Experience

Experience building high-availability applications
Experience configuring multi-tenent Kubernetes clusters
Familiarity with Service Mesh technologies like Istio or Linkerd
Familiarity with event bus technologies like Kafka, RabbitMQ, AWS Kenesis, etc.
Familiarity with data processing and distributed computing tools like Apache Spark or Airflow
Familiarity with secret management tools like Hashicorp Vault, Azure KeyVault, Google Secret Manager, etc.

Why Work at Agilious 

At Agilious, we put our people first. As a team-focused company, we foster a collaborative environment where every employee has a voice, opportunities to develop professionally, and the support to thrive. If you’re looking for a career where you can learn, contribute, and grow, we’d love to hear from you.

Our Benefits

Health, dental, and vision insurance to take care of your health needs
Supplemental Benefits: Life Insurance, Long and Short-Term Disability
401(k) plan with contributions and annual profit sharing
Generous paid time off, federal & floating holidays to maintain balance
Robust Professional Development to continue your education
Employee Assistance Program Support for a wide range of life events and experiences

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

At this time, Agilious will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below. 

Salary Range: $150,000 - $200,000

Welcome to Publix Technology, the award-winning technical group for Publix Super Markets, Inc., the largest employee-owned company in the nation. Our technology teams of 2100+ associates provide innovative, modern solutions to nearly 1400 retail stores and 200,000+ internal team members across 8 states. Job Description

CDM Smith is seeking a DevOps Cloud Architect to join our Digital Engineering Solutions team. This individual must showcase exceptional abilities in implementing cloud technology solutions for AEC initiatives that involve cutting-edge technologies. As a member of the Digital Engineering Solutions team, the Development group will also engage in research and development and provide guidance and oversight to the AEC practices at CDM Smith, engaging in new product research, testing, and the incubation of innovative ideas that arise from around the company. The ideal candidate should possess an extensive background in cloud architecture, that includes security, scaling, integration, and application migration, along with a commitment to continuous advancement and interest that drives measurable results.

The following are the Key responsibilities for this position

A thorough understanding of cloud technologies, including design patterns, planning, configuration, and resource management in Microsoft Azure and other cloud platforms.
Develop DevSecOps culture implementation, integration, pipeline automation as well as high- and low-level architectural analysis. Mentor development teams on pipeline best practices.
Design and develop the infrastructure and CICD pipeline for a range of projects in a various environment in an agile way.
Spearhead infrastructure automation using Bicep, ARM templates, and scripting languages (PowerShell), promoting Infrastructure as Code (IaC) as a core team capability.
Drive adoption of infrastructure as code practices to create reusable solution patterns and templates.
Develop and implement monitoring, logging, and alerting systems that ensure the performance and health of the system.
Establish standards and guidelines across cloud platforms in accordance with industry standards.
Establish guidelines for Azure Active Directory (AAD), RBAC, IAM configuring role assignments, conditional access, and identity management.
Incorporate security best practices into cloud architecture and ensure compliance with appropriate industry standards.
Analyze the cloud service's business needs, investigate the necessary framework, design and implement enterprise-class cloud service providing secure, scalable, and efficient solutions.
Engage in multidisciplinary research on complex systems including serverless, endpoints, networks, disaster recovery management system and hardware/software.
Collaborate with the IT operations, security and other architect teams to ensure that best practices are followed.
Communicate verbally and in writing with non-technical cross-functional teams.
Implement cost-saving measures and analyze resource utilization to optimize cloud costs.
Work with multi-cultural teams across different time zones.

description_text:
Job Description:

Primary Requirement:

Must have some prior experience on the Mainframe.

Must have 12+ years in DEV/Ops

Overview:

Seeking a Sr Professional Dev/Ops Engineer responsible to provide subject-matter expertise in the automation of Dev/Ops environments utilizing CI/CD (continuous integration and continuous deployment) methodologies and practices to speed up and improve software development on a mainframe environment. The ideal candidate should possess Senior level expertise to assist designing the system, participate in installation, monitor its functioning, and provide guidance to the team on its use. A foundational understanding of Mainframes is essential. Also required to have experience with one or more scripting languages like Python, Perl and Shell. Encouraged to have experience with source code management tools like GitLab, CI/CD pipeline tools like GitHub Actions or Jenkins and particularly Linux/Unix experience. The successful candidate should possess a strong willingness to learn emerging technologies including Zowe, API ML and CLI.

Primary Function:

Duties include but are not limited to the following:

Installation, configuration, and support an advanced Dev/Ops automation environment.

Utilize CI/CD methodologies in support in a Dev/Ops automation environment

Integration of mainframe and current CI/CD using scripting languages

Diagnostics analysis within DEV/Ops automation software and the platforms where they exits.

Technical Skills and Experience:


84 months of experience as a Dev/Ops automation engineer
60+ months experience of Installation and configuration of Dev/Ops software.
60+ months experience of support and administration of CI/CD Methodologies.
60+ months experience of integration of software into a Distributed or Mainframe environment.
60+ months experience with Application Program Interface implementation and support.
48+ months of supporting software requiring security compliance and audit readiness methodologies.
48+ months of practical experience using a scripting language like GitHub or Jenkins.
48+ months of experience with Linux/Unix operating systems
24+ months of experience with hands on work in a Mainframe environment
Possess in-depth knowledge of a given computing platform and relevant marketplace; can speak with authority, e.g., on trends, best practices, compliance practices, etc.


People and Communication Skills:


Ability to listen to client requirements and organize them into a list of business needs and objectives
Ability to provide written communication back to the project manager and customer regarding build and integrate instructions, assigned task status, and ability to communicate through channels such as knowledge transfer instructions to run the solution after implementation is complete.
Ability to follow a communication plan established by the project manager
Ability to document clearly all the aspects listed above and ability to clearly communicate in writing project statuses, task status and communicate in writing build and integration results.
Desire to learn emerging technologies including API ML, CLI and integrating in multiple Operating systems and apply them to customer environments.


Key Requirements:

A senior consultant will have a bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 12 years of experience in IT. Minimum Education: bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

You must have some documentable mainframe experience.

Additional Job Description:

Compensation And Benefits

The annual base salary range for this position is $106,900 - $171,000

This position is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus in accordance with relevant plan documents, and equity in accordance with equity plan documents and equity award agreements.

Broadcom offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package: Medical, dental and vision plans, 401(K) participation including company matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave and vacation time. The company follows all applicable laws for Paid Family Leave and other leaves of absence.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Location: Remote, MX
Target Start Date: 7/14
Type: (C, CTH, D) : C
Pay Rate / Salary (Ranges OK): $450/day
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer with deep expertise in Microsoft Azure to lead the design, deployment, and continuous improvement of infrastructure and automation across cloud-native environments. This role is pivotal in driving best-in-class practices in Infrastructure as Code (IaC), CI/CD, and Azure platform services, while collaborating across engineering, QA, and product teams.
If you're passionate about leveraging Azure's full suite of capabilities to create scalable, secure, and highly available infrastructure—this role is for you.
Key Responsibilities
Architect, deploy, and manage scalable, secure Azure environments across IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS offerings.
Lead and maintain robust Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines and automate delivery of infrastructure and applications.
Develop and manage IaC solutions using Terraform and Azure-native tools (ARM, Bicep).
Serve as the Azure SME for infrastructure setup, release strategies, and platform improvements.
Maintain and enhance Azure DevOps components, including Repos, Pipelines, Artifacts, and Boards.
Document and standardize infrastructure configurations, CI/CD workflows, and operational procedures.
Collaborate with engineering and QA teams to troubleshoot issues and optimize cloud performance.
Drive adoption of best practices in Azure governance, cost management, and security (RBAC, Azure AD, Key Vault, etc.).
Implement Azure-native monitoring solutions (Azure Monitor, Application Insights, Log Analytics) for proactive alerting and diagnostics.
Mentor teams on cloud architecture, containerization (AKS, Docker), and modern DevOps principles.
Continuously research and implement innovative ways to improve automation, scalability, and reliability.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, or equivalent experience.
5+ years of hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including PaaS services like App Services, SQL, Functions, and Container Apps.
Deep knowledge of Azure DevOps Services and CI/CD pipeline automation.
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code, preferably Terraform and Azure-native templates (ARM/Bicep).
Expertise in containerization and orchestration using Docker and Kubernetes (AKS).
Proven ability to lead and deliver cloud infrastructure projects end-to-end.
Strong understanding of Azure identity and access management (IAM, RBAC, Azure AD).
Experience implementing DevSecOps practices across the full software development lifecycle.
Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools within Azure ecosystem.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with additional DevOps tools like Ansible, Jenkins, Chef, or Puppet.
Exposure to multi-cloud environments, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Microsoft Azure certifications (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer Expert).

title: DevOps Engineer (3 month contract)
linkedin_org_slogan: Promoting behavioral health access and engagement in all care settings
linkedin_org_locations: 1601 Market St, Philadelphia, PA 19103, US
linkedin_org_description: NeuroFlow helps risk-bearing healthcare organizations improve outcomes and cost of care in complex populations by surfacing and supporting behavioral health needs that typically go undetected and under-addressed. Across payors, providers, and the federal government, NeuroFlow’s scalable technology and analytics capabilities empower organizations with actionable intelligence from real-time data collection and risk stratification, enabling them to manage populations in a financially sustainable way. Powered by deep expertise in whole-person care, NeuroFlow offers a path to risk predictability and proactive care that helps overcome the systemic challenges in today’s healthcare ecosystem.
description_text:
Who We Are 

NeuroFlow CEO and West Point graduate Christopher Molaro served in the army for five years, including a tour in Iraq as a platoon leader. Coming back home, he experienced firsthand the gaps in the behavioral health system and how veterans and civilians alike face too many barriers when it comes to receiving appropriate, timely care.

While pursuing his MBA at Wharton, Chris met his future co-founder Adam Pardes, and the two agreed – even the most engaging digital mental health apps in the world wouldn't truly change the problem; only a solution that systematically integrated behavioral health into the full healthcare ecosystem could create meaningful change. And so they created NeuroFlow.

What We Do:

We pride ourselves on partnering with healthcare leaders to assist in driving better outcomes, lowering total cost of care, and making behavioral health risk more predictable and transparent. NeuroFlow exists to make sure no one who needs behavioral health support falls through the cracks.

We build more than just engaging digital health tools for self-care: we create platforms that identify population behavioral health risk early, engage individuals with acuity-specific resources, and enable care teams to make smarter and more efficient decisions. Together, NeuroFlow's solutions arm healthcare organizations with the insights they need to overcome the systemic challenges in today's healthcare ecosystem.

How We Do It:

The award-winning culture at NeuroFlow is one built around encouragement and daring to be great. Our core values have been displayed in our office since day one, and each team member is responsible for carrying out these values and keeping each other accountable to them. We succeed through our flexibility and agility, navigating and transforming an industry ripe for change where "no" or "can't" is too often the default. NeuroFlow offers unique opportunities to work in a fun and challenging fast-paced environment with direct, meaningful impact on helping to close the divide between mental and physical health.

What You'll Do

The Neuroflow Platform Engineering team is looking for a Sr. DevOps Engineer familiar with AWS, Terraform, and general CI/CD knowledge to augment our staff to assist in Terraform module development, container deployments and service updates in Elastic Container Service (ECS), and small-scope feature requests in AWS. While you'll have a strong point-of-contact partner to work with, we value the ability to work independently and propose solutions.

What You Should Have

A high level of expertise with AWS products and deploying them through Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC). Ideally, 5+ years working daily with cloud architecture and IaC.
Experience working with RDS, as well as Serverless deployments such as AWS Lambda
A thorough understanding of HashiCorp Terraform implementation, deployment principles, and methodology.
Confidence working with CI/CD pipeline tooling and associated concepts. We use GitLab Pipelines and GitHub Actions, but familiarity with adjacent tooling like Travis, Circle, JenkinsPipeline should translate.
Strong understanding of a container deployment platform. Ideally ECS on Fargate, but familiarity with Kubernetes+Helm or HashiCorp Nomad will work.

Potential Projects You'll Work On:

Assist with Terraform Modules Updates, Refactors, and Bugfixes.
CI/CD Pipeline Development for an Upcoming Platform.
Performance Tuning of Existing Build Pipeline.
RDS and Lambda Performance Tuning and Evaluation
Migration of Docker-On-EC2 Services to ECS Fargate Cluster
Upgrading Development Tooling in ECS to Current Release

What We Believe:

NeuroFlow is a proud equal opportunity employer. Every day we are working to tackle the mental health crisis in America, and in order to do that well, we need diverse voices, experiences, and perspectives at the table. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are typically done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on NeuroFlow. Please inform our Talent team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

As a HIPAA compliant organization 

All team members shall:

Act in accordance with NeuroFlow's Information Security Policies. 
Protect organizational assets from unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, destruction or interference. 
Report security events or other risks to the organization 
Execute organizational security processes or activities 
Perform security responsibilities that defined and communicated for their role 
Be responsible for their actions regarding the security of organization

linkedin_org_description: Milliman is among the world’s largest independent actuarial and consulting firms. Founded in Seattle in 1947, Milliman has offices in key locations worldwide. Through consulting practices in employee benefits, healthcare, investment, life insurance and financial services, and property & casualty/general insurance, Milliman serves the full spectrum of business, financial, government, union, education, and nonprofit organizations. In addition to consulting actuaries, Milliman’s body of professionals includes numerous other specialists, ranging from clinicians to economists.
description_text:
What We Do

Milliman IntelliScript is a group of a few hundred experts in fields ranging from actuarial science to information technology to clinical practice. Together, we develop and deploy category-defining, data-driven, software-as-a-service (SaaS) products for a broad spectrum of insurance, health IT and life sciences clients. We’re a business unit within Milliman, Inc., a respected consultancy with offices around the world.

Candidates who have their pick of jobs are drawn to IntelliScript’s entrepreneurial and collaborative culture of innovation, excellence, exceptional customer service, balance, and transparency. Every single person has a voice in our company, and we challenge each other to push the outer limits of our full, diverse potential. And, we’ve shown sustained growth that ensures you’ll have room to grow your skillset, responsibilities, and career.

Our team is smart, down-to-earth, and ready to listen to your best ideas. We reward excellence and offer competitive compensation and benefits. Visit our LinkedIn page for a closer look at our company, and learn more about our cultural values here.

Milliman invests in skills training and career development and gives all employees access to a variety of learning and mentoring opportunities. Our growing number of Milliman Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) are employee-led communities that influence policy decisions, develop future leaders, and amplify the voices of their constituents. We encourage our employees to give back to their varied professions, including leadership in professional organizations. Please visit our website to learn more about Milliman’s commitments to our people, diversity and inclusion, social impact, and sustainability.

What This Position Entails

IntelliScript’s IT organization has been a key part of our past success and is critical to our future. The DevOps Engineer II position will be crucial in supporting the application lifecycle strategy and supporting the execution of the organization's vision for IntelliScript’s industry-leading software projects. Working closely with the Cloud Engineering, Information Security, and Software Engineering teams, this person will act as a DevOps Technical Support Engineer. In this role, you will support the team by handling triage and troubleshooting of ad-hoc requests to reduce the burden on the DevOps team. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to fully break into the DevOps space, with opportunities to grow through the DevOps Engineering career path over time.

What You’ll Be Doing

Provide support for our developer platforms as we perform large-scale migrations
Continually work towards making improvements in developer experience, and enhancing the software delivery process through championing our best-practices
Implement a CI/CD pipeline, consisting of the capabilities needed to build, test, integrate, monitor, and deploy software in a self-service, secure, and repeatable fashion
Support the team by handling triage and troubleshooting of ad-hoc requests
Collaborate on configuration management methodologies and technologies
Enhance security and governance in the Software Delivery Lifecycle (SDLC) via automated compliance checkpoints and stage gates
Promote development best practices and facilitate collaboration between development, operations, cloud engineering and other IT teams

What We Need 

2+ years of relevant experience
Exposure to DevOps tooling & practices (Git, CI-CD orchestration software, configuration-as-code, developing/improving the SDLC process)
Experience with:
Git
Bash/PowerShell
Azure DevOps
CI/CD Pipelines
Docker
Terraform
Familiarity with Atlassian suite of products (Jira, Confluence)
Experience with Agile methodologies
Ability to ramp up quickly on both new technologies and existing technologies
Excellent technical design, problem solving, and troubleshooting skills
Excellent collaborative skills, with strong written and verbal communication
Self-motivated team player who can run with a project and is willing to pitch in as needed
What You Bring To The Table

Technical Expertise: has a good understanding of the DevOps field
Teamwork: ability to work effectively in a team
Risk Mitigation: ability to manage moderate risk
Problem Solving: ability to solve non-route problems
Communication: conveys detailed information effectively and produces well-structured written documents
Continuous Learning: regularly engages in professional development, demonstrates adaptability to new ideas, and integrates new knowledge into daily tasks
Ideation: generates various ideas and solutions for moderately complex problems and explores multiple approaches independently
Embracing Change: adapts to new situations and technologies and begins to suggest improvements
Empowering Others: provides moderate support and guidance, encouraging peers by sharing relevant resources and knowledge
Continuous Improvement: identifies and suggests improvements, helps implement changes, and monitors results with moderate supervision

Wish List 

Continued education, certifications, and/or demonstrated commitment to growth through ongoing learning
Experience with:
GitHub
SonarQube (familiarity with concepts of SAST tooling at a minimum)
Artifactory (familiarity with concepts of artifact management at a minimum)
.NET / C# / Python / Go / etc. (ability to interpret OOP at a minimum)
Experience consuming REST APIs
Experience with Ansible, Packer, and/or other IaC tools
Experience with Scaled Agile concepts and principles
Location 

This position will be based out of the Milliman office in Brookfield, WI; however, this position is open to remote work. Applicants must be willing to travel to the Milliman office in Brookfield, WI for quarterly PI Planning meetings and one annual company meeting. This expected application deadline for this job is July 31, 2025.

Compensation

The overall salary range for this role is $78,800 - $151,440. For candidates residing in:

Alaska, California, Connecticut, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, Washington, or the District of Columbia the salary range is $86,680 - $138,820. 
New York City, Newark, San Jose, or San Francisco the salary range is $94,560 - $151,440. 
All other locations the salary range is $78,880 - $126,200. 

A combination of factors will be considered, including, but not limited to, education, relevant work experience, qualifications, skills, certifications, etc.

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to support employees’ health, financial security, and well-being. Benefits include:

Medical, Dental and Vision – Coverage for employees, dependents, and domestic partners.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) – Confidential support for personal and work-related challenges.
401(k) Plan – Includes a company matching program and profit-sharing contributions.
Discretionary Bonus Program – Recognizing employee contributions.
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) – Pre-tax savings for dependent care, transportation, and eligible medical expenses.
Paid Time Off (PTO) – Begins accruing on the first day of work. Full-time employees accrue 15 days per year, and employees working less than full-time accrue PTO on a prorated basis.
Holidays – A minimum of 10 paid holidays per year.
Family Building Benefits – Includes adoption and fertility assistance.
Paid Parental Leave – Up to 12 weeks of paid leave for employees who meet eligibility criteria.
Life Insurance & AD&D – 100% of premiums covered by Milliman.
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability – Fully paid by Milliman.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description_text:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Stellar IT Solutions, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Job Title: React Developer

Location: Remote

Job Duration: 6+ Months

Interview: Video

Job Description:

We are seeking a Mid to Senior-Level React Developer to support a legacy application modernization project. The role involves rewriting components of an existing WebForms application into a modern tech stack using React with TypeScript and a .NET Core API. The ideal candidate will be comfortable navigating legacy code and helping transition to the new architecture, with a strong focus on front-end development.

Key Responsibilities:

Rewrite legacy services using React (TypeScript)
Translate and understand existing logic written in VB.NET or C#
Collaborate with backend developers to integrate APIs built on .NET Core
Contribute to full-stack development as needed, with a focus on UI modernization

Required Skills:

3 6 years of experience in React development (preferably with TypeScript)
Ability to read and understand VB.NET or C# code
Exposure to full-stack development (React, .NET Core)
Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability in working with legacy codebases

description_text:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

About Us

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in the development and deployment of our innovative energy solutions. As a DevOps Engineer, you will work with cutting-edge technologies and work with a team of talented engineers to ensure system consistency, improve customer experience, and achieve high availability and performance of our services. This role is customer-facing, so excellent communication skills are essential. This is a permanent position offering a fantastic opportunity to work in a fast-paced and technologically advanced environment.

Job Details

Are you a good fit?

Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies on AWS.
Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation.
Define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems on AWS.
Implement systems that are highly available, scalable, and self-healing on the AWS platform.
Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate operational processes.
Work closely with the development team to integrate new deployment processes and strategies.
Maintain and improve AWS infrastructure to ensure optimal performance, availability, and security.
Act as a point of contact for technical issues for customers, providing effective and efficient problem-solving solutions.
Use New Relic and other tools to monitor and troubleshoot systems, ensuring high availability and performance.
Proficiency in AWS and cloud infrastructure management.
Experience with continuous delivery systems and methodologies.
Strong understanding of security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation.

Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!
